greetingSubtitle: Check out the fresh reads from Dan Abramov about useEffects, updates in ECMAScript 2022, and more cool articles in today’s newsletter.

cards.title: Fun CSS-only scrolling effects for Matterday
cards.description: In this article, the author explores the idea of layers obscuring and revealing things to create different illusions and experiment with scroll speeds.
cards.author: Lynn Fisher

cards.title: The Guide To Windows High Contrast Mode
cards.description: From this article, we can learn how to make our sites friendly for Windows High Contrast Mode. Also, we’ll study a handy set of practices we can use for that purpose.
cards.author: Cristian Díaz

cards.title: 8 CSS Snippets That Demonstrate the Power of Shadow Effects
cards.description: With CSS, you can create some seriously impressive shadows. In this article, you will find some top snippets that cover both сommon everyday use and jaw-dropping complexity.
cards.author: Eric Karkovack

cards.title: Ecma International approves ECMAScript 2022: What’s new?
cards.description: On 22 June 2022, the 123rd Ecma General Assembly approved the ECMAScript 2022 language specification, which means that it’s officially a standard now.
cards.author: Dr. Axel Rauschmayer.

cards.title: How Can Programmers Discuss the Project Plan With the Clients
cards.description: Communicating with code owners is an essential part of a programmer’s work. How to communicate effectively?
cards.author: Josef Cruz

cards.title: Infinite scrolling with React Query
cards.description: Pagination and infinite scrolling are effective patterns when working with large data. Infinite scroll helps increase performance in applications, and doing it with React Query is quite simple.
cards.author: Mandah Israel

cards.title: Understanding the Closure Trap of React Hooks
cards.description: Another article about diving into React Hooks. A deep understanding of basic things in React can improve your work efficiency. Let's look at the most classic problem — the closure trap of React Hooks.
cards.author: bytefish

cards.title: Different Ways to Write CSS in React
cards.description: We have several ways to write CSS in React. Thanks to this article, you will find out about other not-so-traditional or popular ways we can do it.
cards.author: Saleh Mubashar

cards.title: You Might Not Need an Effect
cards.description: This chapter of React documentation was announced by Dan Abramov. It will make you rethink working with effects in React.
cards.author: Dan Abramov

cards.title: Every Beginner React Developer Makes This Mistake With State
cards.description: By far one of the biggest beginner mistakes in React is developers storing derived state. This is a huge problem that is incredibly hard to detect unless you know what you are looking for.
cards.author: Web Dev Simplified
